com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection

Class ConnectionBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.connection.ConnectionBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileConnection, NullConnection, SocketConnection

    public abstract class ConnectionBase
extends AbstractConfigurable
implements Connection
    This is a useful base class for other Connection implementations to inherit from.

    It performs the following functions:

    • Manages a simple started attribute.
    • Manages an underlying Properties object that subclasses can use to store their properties.
    • Provides the required Properties constructor.
    • Overrides Object.equals(java.lang.Object) and Object.hashCode() so that connections with identical properties are considered to be identical.
    • Overrides Object.toString() with the underlying Properties toString.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(IConfiguration configuration)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Apply the IConfiguration to this IConfigurable.

        This method is called by the configuration module in the server:

        • when loading the configuration at server startup (e.g. when reading the XML configuration file) and
        • every time we reload the configuration object corresponding to the configurable run-time object.
        The Catalys Server passes a reference to a configuration clone. The original reference is unavailable to the configurable object. The configurable object may decide to store the reference as the last valid configuration object which can be used to optimize the re-configuration.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface IConfigurable
        Parameters:
        configuration - the immutable configuration object
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - This exception is thrown when the new configuration object cannot be applied to the configurable object.

      • getConfiguration

        public final IConfiguration getConfiguration()
        Description copied from interface: IConfigurable
        Return the last valid configuration.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface IConfigurable
        Returns:
        Reference to the last IConfiguration used to successfully configure this IConfigurable.

      • setProperties

        public final void setProperties(Properties properties)
        Sets properties.

        Does nothing if properties is null.

        Specified by:
        setProperties in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties that uniquely define this Connection

      • getProperties

        public final Properties getProperties()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Returns the properties that uniquely define this Connection.

        These properties are used by the ConnectionBase class to define the overridden "equals" method. Two objects are considered to be the same if their properties are identical.

        For example, the properties of a Socket connection would contain IP address and port number.

        Specified by:
        getProperties in interface Connection
        Returns:
        Connection properties. Never returns null although properties may be empty.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException
        Normally subclasses will override this but they will call this base method if they want to let the base class manage the started attribute.

        This method simply calls: 

         setStarted(true);
        Specified by:
        start in interface Connection
        Throws:
        IOException - TBD
